The almond croissant was also excellent, its fat body resulting in sticky fingers and a big mess in front of me when I was done.
author: Josh Q.

description: love this place!  Their ham and cheese croissants are so good!  And their bread pudding is also tasty :)
author: Kevin M.

description: This place is a gem! Absolutely love the almond croissants! Great service, friendly atmosphere and a great backyard.
author: Aly K.

description:
I love their fresh bread and sandwiches. I've been going there almost every Sunday for the past year.

You should definitely try a sandwich. They should think about mixing up the sandwich selection or have a special sandwich of the week in addition to the ones they have.
author: Lou Z.

description: Amaaaaazing ham and cheese croissant, and the blueberry scone is soft and decadent...unlike anything I've ever had before. I got both for $6!
author: Jacquelynn Y.

description: I experienced the thoroughbread deliciousness recently when I came in for a hot mocha and a warm sweet treat . We had warm bread pudding with bananas and chocolate chips baked in, a warm croissant with ham and cheese baked in, and an almond croissant, all of which were absolutely delicious and very fresh. I love that you can go in for a treat and buy a loaf of bread for later.
author: Christy D.

description:
The selection of pastries in this bakery is much, MUCH more to my taste than the selection at most other bakeries, where they revolve heavily around cookies and cupcakes. The 5 stars is for the apple galette. I was so pleasantly surprised when I got it on my way to work one morning. It had the perfect flavor balance of sweet and tart, delicate but not too crumbly, and it was simple and gimmick-less. My coworker got me some mini-cheesecakes and carrot-cakes on my birthday, and they were delicious as well. The prices here don't make me do a spit-take, either, which is often the case for us East Bay folk when we are in the city.

I'm looking forward to coming here some time when I can stay and sit in their back garden, which looks very nice.
author: Shiva K.

description:
I'm kind of reluctant to write this review, as Thorough Bread has been my secret goto spot for excellent baguettes and other baked treats. But I must toot their horn as they are a welcome addition to the slightly stale Church & Market brigade, that doesn't really try. Clean interior, inviting and lovely service. I heart these guys like mad!

p.s. Sometimes I want to gnaw on the bread display.
author: Antoi C.

description:
I've gone here for lunch a few times, their sandwiches come on a fresh baguette and a side salad with what appears to be oil and vinegar (nothing special). The service is great, the sandwiches have been delicious every time (fresh and light), and the portions are great for the price. I have no complaints. 

Definitely suggest stopping by here if you're in the area.
author: Barron K.

description: Amazing pastries and good coffee. I think it is the best almond croissant in SF -- its so fresh and flaky and the almond paste is to die for. They have a good variety of pastries too! I highly recommend this place.
author: Ana Y.

description:
Wandered in here randomly and left with possibly the best almond croissant I've had in my life - crispy, gooey and buttery with a huge layer of almond crust on top (this was the panty dropper).

Definitely worth stopping by if you're in the area!
author: paula m.

description: Much preferred over Tartine. Delicious pastries, excellent coffee. Almond croissants are really good, as are the sticky buns and lemon pound cake.
author: Tyson T.

description: OK, if you ask me this place rocks when it comes to their baked goods. Their almond croissants are on par with the best i have had around the world. The Carrot Cake is freaking beyond and everything is so well done that i never have eaters remorse after indulging here. I just feel light and happy. This is a total feel good place that even has an outdoor garden.
author: JD W.

description: WHAT GOOD COOKIES. and also their tuna & hard boiled egg is delish. only thing i don't like is that they're not open on mondays!
author: Villager E.

description:
I love this place.

I love this place so much, I almost don't want to give it a good review because it means it might become more crowded, they might run out delicious pastries sooner, there might be fewer places to sit.

But, it is too good not to share.  Excellent baked breads and pastries.  Good, strong coffee in a generous sized cup, always hot and steaming.  Friendly service, personal greetings and kind words to welcome you in the morning.  Cream puffs that are so good they challenge my limited vocabulary.  Buttery butter croissants.  Savory bread pudding.  Don't be afraid to ask them to warm up your pastry for you.

My only complaint about this place is that it highlights the lack of really good cafes/bakeries in the city.  This is a saving grace.  There are a few others if you exclude the ubiquitous Boulange (ahem... Starbucks) chain.  Tartine comes to mind.  But Thorough Bread is a rare find in a city that prides itself on the abundance of great food.  The prices are very reasonable - to the point that I often feel I'm being undercharged for such good quality.

Gets a wee bit crowded and confusing at times when the croissants and coffees are rolling out one after another in the weekend mornings.  Perhaps a name based system might help alleviate some of the confusion.  But nothing will deter me from coming back again and again. A wonderful European styled cafe, full of life, delicious offerings and happy patrons.
author: Andy S.

description:
came here suffering from depression at finding M&L Market still closed for the holidays and was greeted by a giant christmas tree made of bread. awesome.

i got a sandwich and was pleased. nothing mind-blowing but definitely worth having.
author: Ronny K.

description:
I have a weakness for baguettes and could not help but step into this super cute place. The baskets of bread and baguettes by the window made me want to eat everything. 

Enjoyed my cup of coffee that arrived in a huge mug and the savory breakfast items on their outdoor seating area. Def a place to stop by if you can find parking.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Best macarons in the city!

Thorough Bread offers many of the items you'd expect to find in an excellent Parisian bakery, but in a distinctly American setting.  For one thing, you're not expected to greet the proprietor immediately upon entering.  You can also get scones, muffins, and other things that aren't especially "French."

The owner is lovely, remembers the repeat customers, and has a good sense of humor.  But the blond cashier was unnecessarily rude to several customers last time I was in.  The outdoor patio is charming.
author: Sven E.

description:
Ever since I knew SF Baking Institute had a bakery in the city, I haven't been back to Acme.  Not that I have anything against them, but price wise, they're about the same, and because of that, they just can't compete.  Besides... I know the cute little SFBI students are schooled in making things taste good.

Cookies... cheap and tasty.  Sourdough... amazing.  Crispy on the outside, full of evenly spaced, gorgeous little holes, and a creamy color.  Perfect looking, perfect tasting.  A slight sourdough tang with complexity and a lovely depth of flavor.  The sesame semolina is excellent as well, boasting a nuttiness and crispy exterior that any baker would be jealous of.  Really, people, this bread is high class stuff.  And for $3+ a loaf.  I'm not saying I would pay much more... I mean it's bread, but I'm extremely happy that thorough, and SFBI is around.

They also have a number of delicious French and european things, like gougeres, and those almond macarons, and different kinds of cakes.

Oh and on the up and up, the service here has been rather good.  I'm not one to notice anything but the food, however, on the occasions I have been here, people have asked me whether I wanted to get free samples (yes!), helped me make the difficult which bread do I want decision, and been patient and understanding as I skulked around in general.  Anyway, bread, check, desert, check, coffee, check, service, check.  All in all a really great gem to have.
author: Zoobs L.

description:
Eating a slice of their homemade multi-grain as I write this, and it's delicious! Crusty on the outside, nice and soft on the inside, perfect slightly toasted slathered in butter, yum!  

But my favourite hands-down is their Gougeres.  These petite morsels of delight are just that, delightful. Light and fluffy with just the right amount of savoury goodness and herbs, they really hit the spot. And at a mere $3.50 for 11, they're an amazing deal!  

The only item I didn't like was their "roast" chicken sandwich.  I was expecting a fairly traditional sandwich and instead I got a strange, goopey filling that resembled mush and tasted, well, just plain odd.  The chicken looked nothing like chicken (think eviscerated tuna instead) and the filling was just unidentifiable.  Not what I expect from a roast chicken sandwich! 

But other than the sandwich issue, I love this place.  Next time I need to try their homemade cakes because they look divine!
author: Saloni D.

description: Good sandwiches too, fresh tasting ingredients, attention to detail, friendly staff.
author: Chisaka K.

description:
they have the best croissants ever. true story.
moreover, they also teach people how to make them. they have weekend workshops and some professional courses.
author: Te R.

description:
Looking for the perfect birthday cake?   Get their moist bursting with yumminess, carrot cake.  I got up in the middle of the night for just one more little piece . . . .  I suspect I'll do the same tonight.  . .  . .IF it lasts that long . . . . .

I think that most baguettes are boring, there's never enough crunch to the crust, and not enough soft center.  Thorough Bread's are perfect and cheaper than a flight to Paris.  

Oui!
author: Cinnamon Z.

description:
Love the Oatmeal Cookies and the mocha I had was excellent. I love coming to this place for a quick sweet snack and drink. Next time, I'll try the selection of breads and other desserts look damn good. 
 
The barista was pretty cool always friendly and chill, so that is a plus when your just hanging out and not having someone glaring at you, for being there too long! 

I'll be back!
author: Valerie D.

description:
I've come here twice now and both times were delicious.  I've had 2 different sandwiches - one veggie and the other not - and they were both excellent. The bread was super fresh and perfect (of course, this being a bread place), and the fillings were good too.  The back patio is fantastic -a nice and quiet place to sit in the sun and enjoy your food. 

But the best part of Thorough Bread and Pastry? The macarons (the french kind, not the american). I've had Miette's, Paulettes, and Philippes, and I can honestly say that Thorough Bread has the best in SF. It's the closest I've found to the great French macarons (that I had in Tokyo, but still, they were from the famous Parisian shops). The cookies weren't too chewy (Miette's downfall), and there was a lot of filling.  Excellent crunch/smooth contrast. And most importantly, excellent flavor.
author: Cara H.

description:
great pastires
great service
great selection
great prices
and....
clean!!!
we'll definitely be coming back to this place!!
author: Franco L.

description: This is the BEST bakery in the city.  It seems like the best kept secret.  Everything here is delicious especially the bread! Try the macaroons and the croissants.
author: Julie B.

description: I have walked past this place a million times but never went inside, because it looked a little too uppity and expensive for my taste. A friend invited me to lunch there, and I was delighted with the quality of the food and service, and the prices were reasonable. Will definitely come back.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Another bakery I tried out in my search for the best baguette in San Francisco.  

Nice friendly staff.

The baguette up well even with the freezing. It grills well. Slight chewy texture. Nice crunch to the crust.
author: Amy F.

description:
OMG it is heavenly. Very East coast atmosphere and I am a fan!!
What a delight. We had the chocolate bread, the little savory cream puffs, and the ham and cheese croissant.
Huge hit!! I brought stuff to go and man I can't get enough. The bad thing is you need to go to the gym for 3 hours after!
author: Alison W.

description: What a cute little place to chill out and relax with a nice cup of coffee or tea...and have a pastry to go along with it. My friend, Sarah took me here and I was hooked. I love their English Breakfast tea. They have an array of pastries to choose from that are freshly baked everyday. I have tried their quiche, bran muffins, and raspberry danish...all very good. I have yet to try their popular items but it just means I must come back again :) Staff is friendly. Love the atmosphere. Love.
author: Mel P.

description: Came here bc someone on yelp said this was the best croissant outside France they ever had.  Ive had better in San Diego from other places in US.  These were good but sort of on a dry side and not enough butter flavor.  Also had quiche and that was better.  Coffee was great.  Solid 3 stars
author: Konki T.

description: Brought 15 different things for a work breakfast. Everything lasted about 10 minutes, guess the selection was a hit!
author: Alison F.

description:
Why can't I just get a good everyday baguette in the city for $1.50 like I should be able to?

Oh wait, I can.
author: Kurosh H.

description: My favorite almond croissant so far in the city.  Very cute and professional neighborhood cafe affiliated with a baking school.  Decent amount of seating and super alternative to Tartine.  I love almond pastries, so I tried the almond croissant, almond brioche, and almond frangipane.  My favorite was the almond croissant.  The parking situation got me and my friend a little flustered, but I want to be back soon!
author: Bonnie S.

description: I love this place!  I love the whole grain bread and the baguettes.  I love the gougeres and the croissants.  I love the workers who are friendly & seem proud of the food.  I love the large variety of beautiful selections--like delicious jewels.  It reminds me of France.  And I love the prices which are very fair for the quality.  It's not as much of a scene as Tartine and I really love that, too.
author: Karen B.

description: My goto place to go have a queit time with hot tea and great...... and I mean great treats.  One of my favorite places in the city! Take a book and hope no one brought there kids.
author: Titan Critic T.

description: Thorough Bread is SUPER YUMMY!! they bake it all fresh daily and they make it better than anyone else, plus, their coffee/espresso is fresh.  they make the best chocolate caramel tart and their bagettes are crunchy and crusty on the outside and soft and chewy slighlty salty perfect in the middle.  I love their coffee cake too.  It's always moist and the berries are still kinda juicy.  Sometimes I get their soughdough loaf for soaking up dense soups and stews or their ciabatta ideal for sandwiches.  There is absolutely nothing I do not like about this place except that they are closed on mondays, however, it does make everything taste better on tuesdays...
author: Hillary E.

description: Great bakery lots of fun and very cute options for desserts. Everyone at the bakery is very friendly and everything I have had from there is very delish
author: Nicole S.

description: Killer chocolate chip cookies, killer sandwiches, killer bread. I highly recommend this joint for lunch, especially on the back patio which is spacious. Had the tomato, basil, mozzarella sandwich on a French baguette and shared a chocolate chip cookie to end on a sweet note. The food is simple but fresh and flavorful and the variety is ample. Nice staff as well. All and all, one of my new favorite places in the Mission.
author: Kim S.

description: There is no way of describing the almond croissant but AMAZING! It's the best I've ever had. Also the cream puffs here make the bearded papa ones taste like it was made from a child's Suzzie bake oven. You can even take classes so you can create your own magic at home. Stop by and try walking out of here without tasting everything in the display counter.
author: T L.

description: 4 Stars for the quality of the bread/pastries and 1 extra star for it being appropriately priced.  It used to be that "daily bread" meant something but at a lot of the fancy baker's you can't afford it anymore.  This place respects its customers and I respect that.
author: Paul T.

description:
Very classical bakery with some of the most decadent and beautiful pastries i have ever laid my eyes on since being in France. 

Their croissants are to die for (both the plain and almond) but what they are famous for is their chocolate sourdough bread. Make sure to get in earlier before they sell out!

Great coffee too, a perfect stop for breakfast or a light afternoon break.
author: Amelia H.

description: This place was totally love at first bite. Love the coffee and the patio out back. Grab a fougasse if you can score one before they sell out
author: Sarah I.

description: Sticky buns and quiches are incredible here. It has less of the wait and price of Tartine. May be a slightly smaller selection but it makes it easier to decide and every thing at this place is delicious. Plus it has this great outdoor patio to relax and enjoy your pastry of choice.
author: Kate D.

description:
We absolutely love this place. Not just for the yummy morsels of pastry goodness or the hot cups of coffee, but also for the nice quiet outdoor space in the back where you can enjoy all that deliciousness far from the prying eyes of the paparazzi..............a slice of heaven on Church Street!

And the staff could not be more pleasant. They obviously love what they do, and we love them for sharing the love with us.
author: Maria A.

description:
What a great place: On top of the Staff that is really helpful, the wonderfully full flavored coffee, yummy pastries and good sandwiches Thorough Bread has a great back patio to enjoy your haul on. And if you feel like staying indoors, you can watch the bakers make the yummy goodies you WILL want to get more of!

Not to be missed: The baked fruit tart.  Mine was pear with a raspberry jam along the bottom of the crust below the pastry cream and dang I wish I had gotten two.

Try at least once: The Blondie sandwich. It's a pulled pork sandwich with pickles on a REALLY great ciabatta bread.  Actually the bread was the best part.  Which should not be surprising since they bake it themselves. I say "try once" because while interesting, it's a little on the sweet side.

And don't forget to check out the giant Christmas tree made of bread in the front window!!! If the Food Network gave a challenge to make a Christmas tree from food this would be the winning entry.
author: Natasha R.

description: I really enjoy stopping by here whenever I'm at Market/Church. They have delicious sandwiches and pastries. GO TRY THEM!
author: J.D. Q.

description:
Felt the need to revise my review ;)

Best shop in the city. I've stopped in every day (except Monday's) for the past two weeks. The pastries here are better than what I got while living in Nice, the bread is the second best I've ever had (losing only to a shop in Berlin, and only because I had a massive 2 year crush on the woman working there....). 

The staff here is super friendly, I would want to come even if the food wasn't good. Thankfully, it is more than good.
author: Alex R.

description: Nothing can prepare you for the first bite into a Rustic Tart! The light crunch, flaky crust, the perfect sweetness and nothing that overwhelms except perfection. Perfect for treats, surprises or for a nice break with a friend. Sadly I don't live in the neighborhood but then again that could be a good thing for my scale. Love at the First bite!
author: Renee D.

description: Great everything.  So many favorites.  I keep going back to the chocolate bread.  Prices were relatively low until recently.  Although the new prices are in line with other fancy cafes and grocers nearby, prices seem to have jumped by a whopping 40-50% (more or less) across the board.  Wish they would have made smaller, incremental increases over time.  Emailed for an explanation but did not get a reply.  At the new price points I will go less frequently, but I will definitely keep going.  At the lower prices I was able to consider the bakery a standard for daily bread...ya know, like back in the olden days.  Those days are over :-/  Despite my disappointment, they are 4 stars in my book!  I used to keep this place under my hat...but clearly the cat's outta the bag.
author: Eddie C.

description: Maybe I have to try more of what they have to offer.  What I've tried so far is good but not amazing.  Their plain croissant and mushroom filled pastry is really good.  I'd definitely come back here for a fresh croissant.  Contrary to reviews, I didn't think the almond croissant was that great.  It was pretty sweet and heavy on the almond filling.  I've definitely had way better.  I've also tried their turkey sandwich here as well.  It was pretty dry and forgettable.  I hope to come back and try more things!  I love a good bakery and am hoping they have some surprises in store for me next time!
author: Nadiyah S.

description:
A great bakery and eatery.  Excellent food, including sandwiches with their fresh bread.  A relaxing outdoor area sits in the back.  The staff is extremely friendly and welcoming.

Not as busy as some of the other popular spots in the area (*cough *cough Tartine) but definitely on the level with quality of food and even better customer service.

Great brunch menus, too.
author: Joel M.

description:
Yum! 

We stopped in to Thorough on a sunny Sunday morning and grabbed a couple of ham and cheese croissants and a slice of apple galette to share. They heated the croissants for us and though they could have been a bit warmer they were still really good. And based on how quickly the galette disappeared it was obvious that we should have ordered two.

I mentioned the sunny morning because Thorough has a cute patio in the back that gets tons of sunlight. If I lived in the 'hood I could envision myself enjoying a pastry and latte daily...I guess my waist line appreciates the fact that I don't live all that close!

Oh, one more thing...one our way out we grabbed a demi-baguette to snack on. Once again, it lasted all of 5 minutes. This was perhaps the best bread I've tried outside of Paris. 
Merci, Thorough Bread!
author: phil h.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying the plain and ham & cheese croissants but they were out. The vanilla eclair I had was nice and light and I ended up buying demi baguettes and ciabatta rolls to take home. At $1 a piece, these are a steal! Perfect for sandwiches or just noshing on with a hunk of cheese. 

After a quick Google search, I saw that they're listed as SF Weekly's 2008 best new bakery so hopefully that'll bring in more customers. When I was in there today the place was completely empty. I'll definitely return to try their croissants and pastries!
author: Nathalie L.

description:
This is my favorite pastry shop in San Francisco.  I love their currant and blueberry scones.  And the other cookies and treats aren't bad either.  And the price?  Cheap, cheap, cheap.  Great deals can be found here.  Buy your cookies by the baker's dozen!  The bread is gorgeous, simply wonderful.  The sandwiches are great here too.  On a warm day it's nice to sit in their back garden and enjoy a hot cup of tea with a sandwich and a pastry (or two).  Thorough Bread and Pastry is the working portion of a bakery school and the employees are students learning how to run their own business.
Did anyone else see the Christmas tree they made baked out of bread and decorated with cookies and baked goods.  The thing was over 6 ft tall and beautiful!  If I had tons of money I'd love them to make one for me next Christmas, but I'd probably eat it.
author: Michael D.

description:
I would give these guys 4 stars except they don't have their fresh bread delivered until after 9am.  I'm sorry, but if you're going to have "bread" in your business name, please serve it at a decent time for working people. 

Really delicious pastries (although pricey) and a nice patio out back.
author: Andrea S.

description: I had a cup of coffee and a chocolate croissant. I found the croissant to be underwhelming after seeing all the other reviews about how amazing they were supposed to be. There are outlets and this could be a good place to meet a friend for coffee or get some reading done. The seats aren't too comfortable though. Didn't try the bread so can't comment!
author: Anais R.

description:
Smells good, looks good, tastes good, this is my new favorite place nearby. 
It's mostly a bakery, but also had tables and a bar like setup so you can feast on your croissants, scones or cakes before you get out the door. I had a loaf of sourdough and a scone. Sourdough could be more sour, but it's easier than growing my own yeast colonies and has a fantastic crust. The staff is very helpful and nice.
When I go back, I'll try their homemade jams.
author: Julien R.

description:
Having now visited Thorough a handful of times, I can safely say this is a very good neighborhood bakery. Thankfully, I refrained from writing about them on my first visit (I wasn't especially impressed). My subsequent visits have been much better.

My favorite item is their baguettes. I usually grab the Acme or Semifreddi fare from Harvest Market or Golden Produce, but damn, Thorough makes some good baguettes. They also seem to be much fresher than what you'll find at the neighborhood markets. I also like the fact that they have a variety of bread sizes to suit your needs (love the little $1 ciabatta rolls)

They also have a variety of breakfast (fruit danishes, sticky buns, scones) and dessert pastries (cookies, brownies, fancy tarts and the like).

I imagine this place will only get better with time. So if you have a bad first experience, be sure to give them a 2nd chance (that's my usual rule for fledgling neighborhood businesses -- it's all about supporting the local bidness).

Update 5/29: I've upgraded my score for Thorough to 5 stars (from 4). Their baguettes are just so good and so consistent (I buy bread once or twice a week here). 5 stars for the bread alone.
author: David P.

description:
My "most improved" award for 2008 goes to Thorough Bread and Pastry. While it really represents a shift in my own perception, I have to say that their cakes are out of this world. After my dismal lunch experience, I was hesitant to dive into their desserts but I'm so glad I did. 

The cakes are where it's at in Thorough Bread. For Christmas, I picked up a Buche de Noel from here that was a show stopper. Dusted with dark, tangy cocoa powder and combed with a serrated tool, it actually looked like a fallen tree limb. It tasted amazing: sweet but not too sweet and moist but not greasy. Then last night I picked up a lemon cream and raspberry cake that was mind-blowing.  We spent minutes dissecting the layers of the cake and discussing its construction. We all had second helpings and again, it garnered rave reviews.

So if you're looking to impress your friends and satiate your taste buds with deliciousness, go to Thorough Bread and Pastry. The coffee is good as well and that outdoor patio looks pretty sweet. It's slowly creeping its way into my food-driven heart.
author: Corey F.

description:
4.5 stars to be exact! rating is for the pastries.

randomly walked into this little place a couple of years ago on the way to Dolores Park. i continue to thank the pastry gods to this day for deciding that i would unknowingly discover the greatness of Thorough Bread's baked treats.

I walked in because their little chalkboard outside announced that they just introduced a variety of jalousie to their menu. ah jalousie, the last good one which i had up til then, in a little bakery in  Paris in the winter of a handful of years past. Thorough Bread offered a handful of fillings, and I asked one of the bakers behind the counter which she would recommend. She quickly said pistachio, and so I got that with a sticky morning bun to go. This was two years ago, mind you. i remember the flavors to this day.

pistachio jalousie: incredibly good. there were a couple of dark, tart cherries in there too, which was a great surprise. alas, they do not make jalousie anymore! i asked the french lady who works there about the jalousie on another visit, and she said they stopped making it due to its lack of popularity. felt a sharp jab to the heart, was about to fall to my knees with fist shaking in the air and scream 'NOOOOoooooooooooooooooo.....................'. refrained, got a baguette, felt a new kind of happy. but seriously, it would terrific to have their pistachio jalousie again. 

sticky morning bun: good, sweet, sticky. not my favorite item on their menu, but yummy nonetheless. make sure to have napkins and water to clean up after you attack this. best eaten with hands, the sticky fingers made me feel 4 again.

almond croissant: JUST DO IT. a must-order. 7 billion calories and 3 tubs of butter per croissant but choose to live a lot and jog the next day. love thyself, pamper your tastebuds with this. i tell people this; i'm not a fan of almonds, i'm not a fan of croissant. but together, and with all that butter... i choose to love myself. and jog til i drop tomorrow. maybe. when this is hot out the oven, GET ON THAT THING PRONTO!

baguette: so damn simple and tasty. i have the smaller one with butter and jam when i eat in, but it's amazing on its own too. just the right crunch/crisp exterior, with a wonderful pillowy and chewy interior. they do it right.

chocolate bread: not usually a fan of chocolate, but this chocolate overload gets a thumbs up. chocolate bread with chocolate chips contained within. mmmmmmmmmm. i dunk chunks of this in hot coffee and indulge in feelings of BOSS.

vol au vent: super flaky, with oozing bechamel at just the right richness and creaminess. the mushrooms taste super earthy, which brings tears of joy to my eyes. always a bittersweet moment when i finish one of these, because i do not want to appear gross and order another one when i have other pastries on the table. this is straight up delish.

coffee eclair: this was decent, it tasted good but i feel that the bakery's other offerings overshadow it.

spinach quiche: not a fan, i thought it was way too eggy to be good. also, it had a light texture which did not seem to be up my ally. as i ate this, all i tasted was tamago/the sweet egg omelet staple served in most sushi joints.

homemade jams: Thorough Bread has quite a selection of these for sale. I've not bought an entire jar of any jam, but they do provide a small container of it to go with your baguette and other breads on request. i'm not sure how much they charge for this single serve, but do try out the different flavors. i love the subtle yet clear flavors of the jams, they taste very clean and 'natural'. the consistency differs per jam, with the runniest i've had being lavender. VERY floral-tasting; i liked it while a friend said it reminded her of her grandma R.I.P ... so to each his/her own on this. the plum jam is a personal favorite of mine, and i'm keen to try their rose jam sometime.

coffees: not the best, i personally think their basic black is weak most of the time. their lattes get pretty foamy though, which makes it fun to drink. i'm a fan of the milk foam 'stache, so i enjoy the froth. the mocha is alright tasting, not the smoothest i've had. would be great if they could up their coffee to match their splendid pastries, as it would elevate the pastry-eating experience to whole new level!
author: Eliza D.

description:
Why they get 5 stars:
1. Right around the corner from my apartment
2. They sent me a letter including a coupon for a free coffee and pastry
3. The wait in line wasn't noticeably aging
4. The woman behind the counter greeted me with a smile and indulged my oohs and aahs when I ogled the variety of goods. She made suggestions to pair with my soy chai tea from another cafe.
5. Raspberry muffin = the best muffin I have EVER tasted. No need for loping off the top and discarding the rest because it is delicious through and through.

They're friendly, professional, and make some damn good food.
author: Rikki W.

description: this was the best food discovery i have made in SF! My eyes lit up when i saw the delicious, and beautifully prepared pastrys, i had the grasshopper and some grougeres... no wait, friendly staff... i actually had to get a second order to take home  2 people recommended the purple wheat baguette... WHOA I havent had bread that good in while!!! and a great price! worth every penny!
author: Robert B.

description: been here a few times, each time the counter help was stand offish and it aeemed like i was bugging them. last time i went, i ordeted a sandwitch and they rufused to make it with the bread advertised. qhen asked abour it they gave me a super weird attitude. the help there acts like they are bitter to work there. management needs to address this as i refuse to go again if I have to be served by pissy hipsters
author: Lorin S.

description: Nom.  I'm not sure what is there to say about this place other than it's amazing.  The pumpkin muffins got rave reviews at the office when I brought them in, their almond pastries have me dreaming of more.  I am hooked.
author: Anna V.

description: Yeah, this place is legit food. No wi-fi, but good lunch/coffee spot.
author: Stephen V.

description: Their baked goods are incredible. Their sandwiches are just average, but the sandwich bread they are made with is amazing. The croissants are so flaky and light - simply delicious.
author: Jim C.

description: Better than Tartine. More selection, less snooty staff, and really fine pastries and breads.  Better than any of the other SF bakeries I've tried, for that matter.
author: Edward K.

description: Best coffee and best scones around. Everyone is friendly helpful and wonderful.
author: Foreign D.

description: I have been going for some time now and is always yummy. Staff is on it  and it feels  like stepping in a Paris shop. Love sticky buns and croissants!
author: Cindy M P.

description:
I have to admit that I ignored Thorough Bread for way too long.  Maybe at least a year and a half.  I am not the most faithful patron of bakeries or patisseries, though I do frequent coffee shops frequently (well maybe not since i had a little aluminum espresso maker move in with me). 

Anywho, after a grueling bike ride one day with Angelo, he suggested we stop by TB for a little bite.  And so i had a croissant and bought a multigrain loaf, the bread was great and the croissant, fluffy and buttery.  That was the beginning of a beautiful relationship that peaked today when i discovered their sausage, mushroom bread pudding.  Seriously, this is the best thing since bread pudding.  It the breakfast cube of the future.  It's got eggs, bread, sausage, onions, 'shrooms, and a whole ton of yumminess.  I seriously have fallen in love with this.  Well it was a short lived relationship, since I kinda devoured it, but as they say, if you love something, stick it in your belly.  In addition, their coffee was strong and they bake a pretty mean bagel (though they need to get a better cream cheese spreader).  And I continue to pick up a loaf whenever I run out.  I also hear they have a pretty mean chicken sandwich.

The people at the cafe are pretty nice, and the patio out back seems perfect for those all too rare times when one may want to enjoy some time in the warm sun.  

I definitely want to try out one of their purple wheat baguettes, I have so many ideas for what i want to do with those nubs on the ends!!!
author: Adrian L.

description: This place deserves 6 stars! I come here every week...it's quiet and warm. Lots of indoor and outdoor seating and an array of desserts and pastries to choose from. I usually come here for their sandwiches, which are all delicious and come with a very simple side salad. The staff is friendly (my coworker thinks that they are also aesthetically pleasing :) and work so efficiently...there is barely a wait! Can't ask for better.
author: Nicole R.

description:
A sticky bun and coffee. What a way to start the day. Both are very good here. The coffee is strong but not bitter, a perfect balance to the sweet stickiness of the bun.

I'll have to stop by here on the way home to pick up some bread.
Perhaps by then, the rating will go up to a 5.

Oh, they have a nice sunny backyard too.
The backyard is not wheelchair accessible.
author: Geordie E.

description: I've been here a few times and have tried 3 different thing each time.  Still have not found one non-delicious baked good. I love the fact that they carry only Harney and Sons teas.  It's become my favorite bakery in SF.  Far better then Tartine which I find highly overrated.
author: beverly l.

description: Delicious almond croissant! The ordering line is a tad chaotic, but I guess eventually you get what you want. The famous macarons are strangely hidden away in the freezer in the back, and you can't even figure out what flavors they have available. I would be back here for the croissant and it seems they have lots of food too.
author: Ryan C.

description:
The breads are great... especially the multigrain.  4 stars for the breads.

Pastries are a bit lack-luster.  I mean, they'd be fantastic in a town that didn't have so many choices, but for SF, they're ranking mediocre to good (as opposed to great to OMG!).  So... 3 stars for the pastries that we tried...they were out of a few, so maybe THOSE were the fantastic ones?!
author: Godot -.

description:
Yes, the croissants here are really the best I've had! The mini chouquettes are great whether you get them savory or sweet, and are reasonably priced unlike another Mission bakery(!)...

The small chocolate bread is mixed with cocoa powder to give it a not too sweet  flavor with a smattering of chips. I just bought one of the multi-seed loafs today and it is so lovely, with a not too hard crust and chewy inside almost like a rye bread.  I like watching the senior pastry guy working on the fine pastries behind the counter. I plan on working my way through many of the things they have! C'est magnifique!
author: david s.

description:
One of the significant joys of city life, is having a place like Thorough Bread bakery in your neighborhood.   I've enjoyed breakfast croissants with coffee, pastries to take home for dessert, loaves of their fresh multigrain bread for toasting at home and frequent lunches of filling sandwiches and fresh made soups.  

Their attractive and friendly staff take orders at the counter, delivering food to your table.  There is a spacious patio in back if weather allows and you find the interior a bit cramped. 

They serve a variety of pastries, all fresh and pleasing to both the eye and the palate.  Sandwich meats and cheeses are of the highest quality, all served of course, on homemade bread or rolls.

Our favorites are the turkey sandwich served on a sesame roll and the roast chicken sandwich served on multigrain bread.  The latter is particularly moist and rich, made of fresh roasted shredded chicken mixed with pine nuts and i believe currants.  Quite unusual and delicious.  

I find it a pleasant alternative to Tartine with its long lines, although Thorough Bread is deservedly popular and often packed.
author: Bill C.

description:
Stopped in today for a sandwich to go.  Four or five sandwich choices, each on a different type of bread, were on display under the glass counter. I opted for the ham and cheese on baguette, hoping that the baguette wouldn't be overly crusty and cut up my gums. Turns out, the texture was perfect, a little crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside. And the sandwich struck a good balance between bread, ham, mustard and swiss cheese, not like at your average deli where you get a one-inch-thick mass of ham between two sad, soggy slices of bread.

The coffee was good too. I'm looking forward to coming back and trying the pastries.
author: Andy S.

description:
Though the atmosphere and location of this place are both really great, the lunch that I had there was pretty disappointing. The service was incredibly slow, made especially frustrating because there were only a few other people there and no one else was waiting for food. The french onion soup tasted...well...kind of bad and was served to us at near room-temperature. The tuna melt tasted so much like vinegar that I couldn't taste the fish. It definitely wasn't worth the slightly hefty $23.00 price tag for the two sandwiches/soups we got.

I didn't try their coffee or their pastries which other people seem to have liked, so maybe consider this when reading my review...
author: Adam L.

description: This place is delightful.  First of all, the employees act as if they're glad to see you come through the door.  That's a pleasant switch from most all other businesses.  Then, the sandwiches.  Best is the pulled pork sandwich, with a chipotle (not spicy hot) BBQ sauce !  And, I love the mild, but delicious roast chicken sandwich on focaccia bread.
author: Eddie W.

description:
The select pieces I have had here and there of danishes and what not were quite tasty. The counter lady has  been nice. The whole two times I've been.

On my second visit I ordered a chicken sandwitch, eclair, cup of asparagus soup. They asked me if I wanted my sandwitch hot. I assumed that was the optimal way to serve it so I said "sure" not ever of having had it before.

It took maybe 20 minutes to prepare my food. I was the only patron and I found it a bit off it took so long. I got my goods with a nice smile and left.

The sandwich was horrible. It was a sea of hot mayonnaise and wilted/cooked lettuce. Yuck! It was a shame because I nibbled the top of the bread and tried to extract some chicken from the hot mayo and it looked like it had pineuts in it and should have been tasty. The top of the bread was good but the chicken was unsavable after being microwaved. Too salty and well ok I can't get over separated hot mayo.

The soup was burnt, watery, over salted, and the asparagus like strings of plastic bag.

Eclair? What eclair? Never made it into the bag but I did get a box of crisp lettuce I guess I was supposed to remove the cooked lettuce from my sandwitch and replace it with.

too bad $12 flushed down the toilet.
author: Kitten M.

description:
Mmmm I love a delicious pastry. I was so excited to try Thorough Bread last weekend, mostly because I love the name. Their selection of pastries, breads, and desserts is wonderful. Very classic treats like eclairs and tarts, croissants and muffins, and lots and lots of bread. I decided to stick with something simple--a blueberry scone with a cup of tea. Absolutely wonderful. Crispy on the outside, but not dry like many scones can be. My friend got the apple gallete, which had a very delicate and delicious crust. They even brought us over samples of desserts, which were also tasty.

I went back there this morning for a sticky bun. It was quite gooey and sticky and sweet. The bread was moist and cinnamony. I loved it.

Their pastries are not pretentious like Tartine and Boulange (though those places are amazing). They have a very homemade feel to them, and you can even see them being made right behind the counter.

The staff is really friendly, but not insincere about it. They will let you sample whatever you want!
author: Allison M.

description: Almond croissants are outrageously delicious.  Lots of almond filling. Better then all the La Boulanges combined.   Great space too - nice outdoor patio to relax.
author: Wakako U.

description: Thorough Bread is just wonderful!  The staff is terrific: friendly, courteous, efficient. A special  kudos to Barrett; however everyone is truly just very, very engaged, responsive and kind.  The food and coffee is excellent,( the cream puffs are to,die for!) the patio a peaceful haven. Best of all, people talk to each other: they're not only zombies isolated and occupied with tapping on their IPhones.  Last of all, its a nostalgic reminder of Just Desserts that was there years ago!  Congratulations!
author: Hedi S.

description: This place is really great. Super friendly staff and deeeelicious pastries, desserts and sandwiches. I go here quite often for the bostock (yum) and our employees hit this place up every day for something or other. One has developed a dependency on the chocolate bread. It can get quite busy but nothing compared to the throng at that other bakery on 18th and Guerrero and they have more variety. Check this place out!
author: Eric F.

description:
Just discovered this place today -- and such a great find!  Beautiful pastries: cakes/ scones/ muffins/ tarts.  I didn't indulge today, but did have a fantastic cherry tomato tart.  The sandwiches also looked great.  Lots of fancy coffee choices to go with your lunch or snack.

They also have a nice patio out back where you can enjoy your meal "al fresco."
author: Kimberly G.

description: Puuuuurfect pastry.  No scene.  The nicest guy ever waited on us. Great hanging out in the back patio on a warm day.  Relax.  Be satisfied.  Try it.
author: Cathy L.

description: I live in the area and visit here at least once a week.  Everything is really cheap and fantastic.  I think it is even better than Tartine, which is a few blocks away.  I would tell more people to come here, but I like that it isn't super busy.  It has a great backyard space to have a pastry and tea and enjoy the morning.
author: Jonathan U.

description: This place is simply amazing... never had such an amazing croissant and pain au chocolat (chocolate croissant) in the city!! Also have some amazing looking bread and dessert that I still need to try!
author: aude h.

description: Almond Croissant, Chocolate Bread, and a Double Chocolate Chip Cookie...I can never be more happier of my purchase from Thorough Bread & Pastry. I am coming back! YUMMY.
author: Michelle D.

description:
I've been stopping by a few mornings each week just to try each item they have and they are all winners!!  I started with the scones and worked my way up.  I haven't tried any of the sandwiches yet.  The pastry cannot be beat.  Even the simplest items are baked with the utmost care.  The atmosphere is very quiet and the staff friendly and knowledgeable.  

Friends I've taken have all agreed this place is great.
author: Carl C.

description:
The best bread of town with people who know and like what they are selling. 

The fougasse is to die for. Till now everything I have tried was well done.
author: micou f.

description:
chocolate bread, how i adore thee!  your perfect ratio of crust to soft bready interior makes me swoon.

i dragged a girlfriend in because i just had to try the chocolate bread and we both heartily approved of it.  it's a generous double-fist sized roll of bread, with a beautifully shiny crust that gave way to a moist, bready, chewy slightly chocolately interior studded with chocolate chips.  it was just sweet enough and we restrained ourselves from eating the entire thing in just a few bites, which would have been really easy to do.  Between bites, we both agreed we couldn't live without carbs, especially the chocolate laden variety.

she also bought a couple of whole wheat chocolate chip cookies, which were buttery disks of deliciousness!  we'll be back for more!
author: Janet L.

description:
A nice little cafe on Church Street.
The croissant is amazing there. It's very flaky, and baked to just right. A little crunchy on the outside. You definitely way better than those typical hard outside, mushy inside kind of you get at a regular cafe.
The rest of the pastries look good too, but didn't get a chance to try them. 
They have a back patio which would be quite nice to chill on a warm sunny day.
author: Jacky L.

description:
The BEST scone I have ever tasted, and I eat a lot of scones. 

The seating in this bakery is open and airy, and there are tables on a welcoming and private back patio. The atmosphere was peaceful inside and outside, and the service friendly and very helpful. I was in heaven here and can't wait to go back.
author: Diane J.

description: The chocolate croissant is to die for! I swear it tasted just like the croissants from the pâtisseries in Paris.  Flaky, soft, buttery; it's just oozing with yummy goodness.  The sandwiches are flavorful, and the bread was delish also.  This place is heaven for a girl who loves carbs.
author: Linh D.

description: What a treat. Great bakery near my brother's apartment and I could just spend hours here reading and having my cappuccino and a croissant. The pastries are really fabulous and a can't miss!
author: Helen B.

description: Love it. Try the chocolate bread! It has a really nice patio area out back. Better on a warm day than a cold one. High quality backed goods and a very fair price. Many different breads, cakes, pastries and pies. Also a good bet for thanksgiving. Never had anything I did not like.
author: andrew w.

description: While I will forever mourn the loss of the place I got my birthday cakes as a child (Just Desserts), Thorough Bread makes a pretty great replacement. I like that they support the San Francisco Baking Institute's Bread and Pastry Professional Training Program. Contrary to others' comments, I don't think their prices are any different from any other good bakery in town, and, in many cases, are lower. My $2.50 lemon pound cake was a perfect afternoon treat and the little bag of sugar cookies I picked up from there on Easter was perfect.
author: Katie I.

description: Full disclaimer: I did not have any pastries during my visit here, so my review is probably skewed simply because of what I chose to order. Still, the sandwich that I paid almost $8 for was pretty lackluster. A turkey sandwich with carmelized onions ended up with minimal amounts of turkey, literally two small strips of onions and a whole lot of bread. And really, the bread wasn't so amazing that I missed out on the filling. For $8, I want more turkey!!! I want to feel like I got a good deal and a great sandwich, but I did not. I do like that they include a nice green salad with a balsamic vinaigrette with the sandwiches, but alas, even that wasn't enough to convince me to raise my score. Their pastries looked good, and according to the lady sharing my table, their croissants are "decadent." I guess in my quest to not get fat this holiday season I missed out on their speciality. Their service was good and I like that they make their sandwiches to order, but meh, I probably won't ever need to go back.
author: Amanda S.

description:
Having only tried two pieces of bread and a latte here i can not give a totally accurate rating of all that they serve, but what i did have I really liked.  The latte was tasty, and i think it was much better than the bland Church St Cafe that neighbors this store.   The baguette and focaccia were perfect.  The baguette was still warm on the inside, light, fluffy, delicious.  The focaccia was not only very tasty but also has an amazing buoyancy on the inside.

This bakery is a welcomed change from Tartine.  Although Tartine is DELICIOUS, this bread at thorough bread is also delicious, but you don't feel like eat bite is a pound of butter.  

Also, this place opens at 7am, which is a welcome change for the early morners in the area.
author: Andrew r.

description:
great stuff. i will absolutely be back. 

nice flaky almond croissant with what i can only describe as a semi-cookie topping. i hearts it.
author: Regina C.

description: I love this cafe so much. I eat lunch here almost every day! I look forward to the delicious fresh breads, rich espresso, wonderful employees and the chill atmosphere. I love watching the face of every new person who I bring here as they taste the food for the first time! Amazing! The only problem is deciding what to order.
author: Christina B.

description: My alternative to tartine might just replace it, I don't think they serve wine but they actually have tons if seating, they also have a cute guy whos behind the counters, that's a plus! The olive bread is delicious, I love the wide variety of sandwiches, chocolate bread! And tons of other goodies.
author: Tiff W.

description: LOVE the staff. Pastries are insanely great. This is where you go if you want to taste what a croissant is ACTUALLY supposed to taste like. Cute back yard too. Love this place.
author: Daniel K.

description:
The coffee is great.  I've only had a few pastries all of which were very good..  

The decor and atmosphere are great.  I love the brick wall, and the back patio is is a gem when the weather is right.

I had the Blondie pulled pork sandwich for lunch.  It came with a nice mixed green salad.  The pork was very tasty and, as you'd expect, the bread was fresh and good.  My only complaint is the price -- its a bit on the high side for the quantity you get.
author: Robb K.

description:
thanks paul for pointing out this place.  had almond croissant, gougere, and macaron (come as 3 -- soft and delicate, like they should be)
was impressed, particularly the croissant had perfect texture and flavor, very nice sweetened crunch top
author: Rob C.

description: Their famous almond croissant doesn't have the kind of finesse you'd find at some of the other bakeries in vogue in this city, but it's pretty delicious, which is really all that matters. Other pastries are good, too. The connection with student bakers is fun.
author: Brian C.

description: PLEASE open one in Pac Heights / Marina...pretty please? Love their croissants, their baguettes, their cakes, thier pain au chocolat...Its all good, just a little bit of a trek for me.
author: Rebecca W B.

description:
A much chiller environment than Tartine - no lines to contend with and cheaper prices to boot!  Perfect for a lazy sunday morning reading the paper.

Tried the almond croissant (flaky with a generous amount of filling) and a savory cheesy scone-like thing that wasn't quite a scone - both were very fresh and delicious and on par with the best bakeries in the city.
author: Jeremy C.

description: I live 1 1/2 blocks from Thorough Bread.  It takes all my willpower not to go there every day (except Monday when they are closed).   Baguettes that I daydream about.  Great turkey pepperjack sandwich (probably their others are good but I can't stop ordering the turkey).  A nice variety of cookies that are only 75 cents - it seems like I pay at least $1 for a cookie everywhere else.  Like others, I love the almond croissant, but I find I can't stop eating it and before I know it I've consumed what I fear is a thousand calories.  Friendly, helpful staff, obvious pride in the food they serve, a nice environment to sit and have some tea and a chat, or just read a good book.  I am thinking of moving in about a year but it will be hard to tear myself away from this neighborhood spot.
author: Jennifer A.

description: I love this place!  Great pastries and bread. The prices are very reasonable.  Three pastries for $6!  I only wish they had bread when they first opened in the morning.
author: laurel t.

description: Stopped in here for lunch one day after exhausting all other options. I ordered a Caprese sandwich and was pretty disappointed. While the atmosphere is pretty nice, especially if you can sit in their rear patio, the lack of patrons was a little concerning. My sandwich wasn't horrible, it just was super bland, with far too much mozzarella to other ingredients., i felt like I was eating bread with tasteless cheese. But on the bright side, it was clean and the employees were nice. I probably wouldn't choose to come here again, but it's a decent last resort when you're staving and just need to eat lunch right now.
author: Allyson S.

description: Nice ambiance. I'm a fan of their bread but the sticky bun gave me a heartburn.
author: Prague G.

description: The almond croissant here is an incredibly great way to start the day.  Staff here are very friendly too!
author: Tony V.

description: Thorough Bread has overtaken Boulange Bay Bread on Pine my favorite place in SF for almond croissants! Hot from the oven, they're crispy, flaky, and decadent...
author: Terry N.

description: mmmmmmmmmm I love this place!  Whenever I get a chance... I come here for the caramel napolean!  It is heaven!
author: Jasen L.

description: I've been absolutely thrilled on my visits in the last couple of months.  The front has been very well-staffed, the wait isn't a problem anymore, everybody is so cheerful and friendly, and everything tastes unbelievably good.  I can't express how wonderful it is to have a bakery like Thorough Bread in our neighborhood!
author: John C.

description:
BEST BAKERY in San Francisco!!  As soon as I arrived into San Francisco, first order of business was to go to two bakeries.. Tartine and Thorough Bread... and I'm so glad I saved the BEST for last!!  They're just in walking distance, roughly 7 blocks apart, so I deemed it 'exercise' to make room for more decadent pastries.  Very decently priced and even cheaper than Tartine.

Almond Croissant:  MUST TRY!!  Divine, heavenly perfection!  Do not leave Thorough Bread & Pastry without trying one or taking one home with you.  I ate one there and took two to go, which were eaten 2 days later and they were as delicious.  By far, the most amazing Almond Croissant I've ever tried!!  

Chocolate Bread:  Never had anything like it before, and I wish I bought more than one because it was just delicious. Crispy crust on the outside, soft bread with chunks of chocolate on the inside - just mouthwatering.  Mmmmmm.

Sourdough Bread Braid:  Good sourdough bread. Was super hard to eat the next day though.

Bread Pudding: with Mozzarella cheese, Sausage and Roasted Red Peppers - Savory, fluffy and the boyfriend loved it!

Super friendly cashiers!  Took the time to make recommendations and have patience with me as it was my first time there, and smiled the whole way through!  

Can't wait to go back to San Francisco just to stop by Thorough Bread & Pastry..... so sad there's no bakery like this in LA.
author: Kat M.

description: Almond croissant is excellent, everything else great.  What else to say?  Closes at 7pm and on Monday.
author: Dave B.

description: My favorite cafe in Duboce Triangle is also my favorite bakery. I feel so lucky to have them right down the street!
author: Rebecca W.

description: I am a huge fan of this place for their quality breads and excellent pastries. I've tried their baguette (great!), their carrot cake (great frosting, even better moist texture), and various other things here and there. I haven't had a single bad experience and like how they mostly employ aspiring pastry chefs from local culinary schools.
author: Andrew H.

description: After walking by this bakery for possibly years, I finally stopped in her to grab a cookie.  I walked out with a baguette, french macaroons, cookies and an eclair, and they were are so delicious!!  The macaroons were my favorite that I have had in the city, and I am looking forward to trying more items off of their menu.
author: Mira B.

description:
Oh, how I love this place.  It's starting to become better known, so unfortunately it can get crowded, especially if the weather is dreary and the back patio is closed.  That's about the only bad thing I can say because the people who work here are friendly, the prices are super reasonable, they do the best plain croissants in the city (this is a huge deal for me- I hate overcooked overbuttery fancy bakery croissants almost as much as I hate those soggy coffee shop things), and they have a great rotating selection of breads. Teff bread and challah, homemade jam, beer, lovely french macarons, chocolate tarts with a thick layer of salty caramel on the bottom...
The sandwiches and soups are solid if not as amazing as the baked goods.

It's not just a great place to get food- it's a great addition to the neighborhood because they work hard to be good neighbors. 
Check out their holiday window displays or stop by on a Saturday when the knitting circle is hanging around to see what I mean.
author: saru k.

description: This place rocks.  I go and get coffee and a baked good here alot.  The pumpkin muffins are orgasmic!  The goat cheese quiche with tomato is awesome.  The coffee is smooth.  Super wonderful owners!  A great place to meet friends.  Love It!
author: brad s.

description: Haven't had a croissant so impeccably crafted since I lived in France. Never thought I'd say it but this place gives Tartine a run for it's money!
author: Rebecka J.

description: dangerous and heavenly at the same time. Awesome baked goods and pasteries .Nice staff. And try the sandwiches they are delicious.My favorite is the bbq pulled pork
author: Lauren V.

description: I adore this bakery! My husband and I go every Sunday before church and it is always delicious. Yummy mochas, lattes and pastries... what more do you need?
author: CC M.

description:
This place always has the friendliest cashiers! The woman standing in front of me asked about their custard-y bon bons and was given one to taste with no questions asked! 

Their Teffe Meche (sp?) ($5) is a very sweet and wonderful sandwhich bread, made from teffe, a gluten-free seed frequently found in Ethiopian cuisine. (Note: Teffe is a gluten-free food, but the Teffe Meche bread is made with a mixture of flours so is not gluten-free.)

Their baguettes are always fresh, tasty and affordable at $1.50. 

Had their chocolate cookie, which was nice, but have never splurged on the delicious-looking desserts. (My waistline is thanking me as we speak.)
author: julia k.

description: The almond croissants are my all-time favorite.  I used to be a fan of Tartine Bakery but the crowds and prices there got out of hand, so this is my bakery of choice now.  Love the almond croissants.  The patio out back is really enjoyable and this place would get an extra star if they improved their coffee...somewhat bitter.  Did I forget to mention that the almond croissants are great??
author: Paul S.

description: Thank you Yelpers for leading us to this place.  Absolutely delicious!  My husband an I shared an almond croissant, plain croissant and sticky bun.  As delicious as the pastries in Paris, FR.  Hubby said the coffee was excellent. We walked a mile to get here from our hotel and totally worth OTC. Although, we probably need to walk 5 more miles just to burn off a portion of the calories.  They have a bathroom which was a plus because I had a cup of Starbucks on the way.  Pricing is also very good.
author: Fawn W.

description: I've become somewhat of a regular at Thorough Bread & Pastry, much to the chagrin of my waist-line, I fear. I work from home and need a nice place to meet with clients, Thorough Bread has become that place. The shop is charming. The coffee is great. And the pastries are wonderful (as evidenced by fore mentioned waist-line). The staff is friendly...the atmosphere is inviting...just a really great neighborhood bakery.
author: Jerome I.

description: This place is amazing. The staff is relaxed and friendly, and the pastries are to die for. Had the goat cheese, basil and red pepper quiche with a coffee and was a very happy camper. Plenty of room to sit and relax. This is my new favorite neighborhood spot!!
author: Tamara M.

description: The best almond croissant ever: warm, light, fluffy, fluffy, with tons of almond paste inside. And the chocolate bread=heaven. If only their vegetables soups were vegetarian (yesterday they had chicken broth in them).
author: Bee H.

description: Best dang bread in the City, which we found out on a late Saturday morning.  A huge bummer that you can't get it until after 9am, which we found out on Tuesday after jonesin' for two days.  So, if you don't work usual office hours, you're in luck.  Sigh...
author: Esther R.

description:
Boo for not letting me carry my doggie inside, so I didn't have to leave her tied up somewhere. She's an escape artist you know.

Now I don't go as much because she can't come inside and their sandwiches aren't too yummy.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
My friend brought me a sandwich when I was in the hospital with Asthma problems.  It was pulled pork on chibatta.  It was the perfect sandwich and included greens with a wonderful vinaigrette dressing.  he also included a bag with three chocolate chip cookies that I ate one after the other--  I wasn't on a special diet, but don't tell my Doctor.  A few days later he brought me a turkey sandwich on very good whole grain type bread. Oh, yes more chocolate chip cookies.
I use to hang out in the courtyard out back when it was a coffee house.  It is the perfect place to meet friends.  I look forward to visiting again soon.  I also look forward to buying the bread.  I use to travel to Acme and Tartine for good bread,  now I can get it on the walk home.
author: Antony E.

description: Great neighborhood bakery.  The chocolate bread is surprising and delicious.
author: LT B.

description: The buttery, flaky almond croissants are to die for. They have a crunchy exterior texture but is oh so soft and tender on the inside. My mouth waters just thinking of them. They know how to bake em.
author: Isabella L.

description: The quiche I had this morning was so watery and so salty I was tempted to ask someone to put it in a blender for a couple of minutes so I could gargle with it.
author: Junior T.

description: Sandwiches and pastries were delicious, but the staff was quite rude. Since it was my first time there, I didn't know exactly what I wanted, but the staff didn't seem to have any patience for new customers. The lady with the short hair and two cheek piercings was particularly smarty and rude. In addition, my friend ordered a sandwich with some modifications and when one of the employees (a lady with blonde hair) came to set down the sandwich she said, "Here's your special sandwich with everything changed." Although the food was tasty, Thorough Bread & Pastry has some work to do on their customer service!
author: Jessica M.

description: I probably never would have noticed this place without Yelp and my ongoing search for sandwiches near my house. The pulled pork sandwich (roughly $9 with small side of greens) was pretty good... it left something to be desired, but I would eat it again sometime. Their coconut macaroons are - dare I say - better than the ones from Tartine (but also double the price). It's the adorable, spacious back patio, though, that makes this bakery a four-star find! What a lovely spot to enjoy some coffee on a nice day. I'll definitely be back.
author: Stephanie P.

description: My new favorite neighborhood place!  They have wonderful sandwiches on FRESH baked bread.  The almond croissant drives me C R A Z Y !!!!
author: Wendy K.

description: My friend lives down the block from this place and I went there every morning, pastries are freshly baked and delicious - you can't go wrong with anything in this place everything IS that good and pretty cheaply priced.
author: Marianne S.

description: They made an amazing Lemon Mousse Cake for My Fiancées birthday and it was amazing!!  It was a huge hit with everyone who came.  Thank you Thorough Bread.
author: Warren K.

description: Best bakery in San Francisco. The fruit tarts, almond croissants, sourdough bread, sandwiches....all incredible. The garden out back is great for a nice cup of morning coffee. I have not tried the cakes yet, but the breads and pastries always have the same wonderful, delicious flavor.
author: Christina G.

description:
Love this place. Nice atmosphere, including the back patio.

Second the comment about best baguettes outside of Paris. A mini one goes great with your coffee for breakfast. Pastries are also fantastic (come on, everyone that works there is from the culinary institute) albeit a tad on the expensive side. 

The espresso is better than the drip coffee, though the latter is perfectly fine too.
author: V C.

description: Blueberry scones that are warm and moist at 10:30 on a Saturday?  Delicious flaky, authentic croissants? Yeah, I can get down with that!
author: Jeff P.

description:
Best baguettes outisde of Paris...or Lyon, France!
Blistery crunchy crust and airy delicious on the inside.
Lovely patio and great customer service.
author: Sara K.

description: Wonderful pastries and the people who work there are some of the friendliest people in the city.  I don't go there for the coffee... could be stronger.  But I go there almost weekly nonetheless.
author: Oralea H.

description: I love you thorough bread!!!! especially on fridays.  the chocolate bread is the best bread i had ever put in my mouth.  the crunch from the top layer of the bread is oh so crunchy.  the texture of t he bread is like no other.  oh and i cannot forget to mention there are chocolate bites in the bread just like a chocolate muffin.  there are so many pastries that looks so delicious and i guarantee you it does taste delicious.  I want to try all the breads and all the pastries.  but i have to limit myself.  carbs are good but not that good for my body.  i look forward to a friday every week pay day or not, chocolate bread you are all mine!!!!!
author: Mimi S.

description:
a friendly neighborhood place. i have only had the macarons here and they were tasty as all get out! employees were very helpful with my order (needed quantity for an event), and even gave me 3 extra free macarons in different flavors when i picked em up! love that. 

i like the decor and the vibe of this place; it's charming but doesn't seem like it is trying too hard, like so many places in sf. patio looks sweet.

dislike the logo, if that matters at all in the slightest!
author: Sally R.

description: I get my starbuck's coffee then rush over here to get a pastry to pair with my coffee. I think I have been here four times this week just for the jalapeno polenta bread! Seriously, I need to quit you and start eating real food! LOL
author: Billy T.

description: Had the sticky bun this morning and it was fab! The coffee is not fantastic. With better coffee I would give this place 5 stars.
author: Chas B.

description: The sandwiches kinda suck. Overpriced and skimpy portions. Sounds like the bakery is good tho. Not coming back.
author: Jim O.

description:
Thorough Bread and Pastry is where Just Desserts used to be on Church.

I stumbled upon this cute bakery and have been wanting to try the croissants. Ham & Cheese Croissant (2.75) is very flaky and tasty, but not with many layers. Plain Croissant (2.50) is just as flaky and fluffy, but doesn't taste like a lot of butter. 

They opened promptly at 7 am in the morning and the girl behind the counter is friendly. She greeted us with a smile and brought coffee (which I didn't expect) to our table. I had an au lait (2.50) and for a refill of drip coffee for just 50 cents!

Breakfast and paper over the back patio would be very lovely on a sunny, warm day. Overall this is a pleasant new-comer of a cafe in the neighborhood. I'll certainly go back and try the other goodies, like the tempting raspberry scone, the sticky bun and the napoleon.
author: Matthew Y.

description: The Best Almond Croissants ive found. Damn tasty scones, and nice sticky buns. Wish I lived closer so I could go here everyday. The blonde who helped us out was amazing. Will be back and will recommend.
author: Franky G.

description: I love this place!  We've been going here since it opened (fall of 2008 I think) and it's great.  Love the back patio, love the sandwiches and baked goods (favorites: danishes, quiches, almond croissants, bostock and muffins).  Coffee is just OK.  My husband also loves their baguettes.  Service used to be better but there are new servers in here a lot.  The regular servers are great!  Tip: Order your thanksgiving pie from here- so delicious!
author: Sarah W.

description: This is a cute, cozy cafe with metered parking along the street.  I had the tomato, basil and cheese quiche and a cup of coffee.  It was pretty delicious.  They served the coffee in a soup cup, the coffee was strong and good.  I got 2 different choquettes ( looks like miniature popovers) and some whole wheat chocolate chip cookies to go.  I ate them later and they all were delicious. They also have a large variety of breakfast items and desserts. Would definitely come back for a second round.
author: Tamy L.

description: Best baked goods and bread ever.  Better bread than Bouchan in Napa believe it or not.  I had the pecan scones and it had the perfect crust.  I brought the olive bread ($5) home and it has the crispy crust that most french breads should have but are missing.  La Brea's bread from Whole Foods had the crispy crust, but recently it's missed the mark - they must have changed the recipe or something so I don't buy La Brea anymore.  The girl at the counter could be a little nicer, but hey I can deal with it for the quality of food here.
author: H G.

description:
My hips and thighs HATE this place! 
The best cream puffs of my life - shortbread to die for - chocolate chip cookies that melt - REAL bread! The absolute BEST bakery in the city, hands down! 
And in good weather I like to sit out the back with a delicious sandwich, very peaceful patio.
author: Jackie D.

description: Love  this  place! Yummy  eats, nuclear  hot  coffee, friendly  staff.
author: Spike B.

description:
their almond croissants are one of the best in the city. for a really hip area, this spot is actually quite nice and humble. 

i had a steaming hot, fresh out of the oven blueberry scone last week. haven't had anything that fresh and hot like that in a long time. 

their chocolate bread is another winner.  love passing through here in the mornings during my weekends, especially since it's so close by. perfect morning bite.
author: Hugo B.

description: from my place i walk right past at least five cafes to go to this one.  the pastries and bread are amazing.  the almond croissant and the country bread are little slices of heaven.
author: Patrick M.

description: Their pastry and food is really amazing. I also like their varieties. They have a nice area to eat and hang out at the back. A great place for brunch. Highly recommended!!
author: Weilun C.

description:
I eat here often for lunch, as I work right nearby.  

I usually get their garden or tomato basil and mozzarella sandwiches.  They are very tasty, you can tell the ingredients are fresh and the bread is very good.

They recently started making tuna melts, and although they take a bit longer to make, really satisfy my taste buds' craving.

The soup is always good too.

I wish they had a half-sandwich soup deal, but it still gets 5 stars: great food and great staff.

EDIT:  I forgot to mention that the cheesecake is divine!
author: Adam C.

description:
um... adorable. delicious. good selection of breads and pastries... if they werent a little pricey i would have gotten so many more treats. i saw they had some sandwiches you could order (good variety) but the only thing i didnt really like was that there was only 1 or 2 vegetarian choices. oh well. i think you can order drinks and stuff too, but i didnt.

got a baguette earlier today, so good! great crust and soft delicious inside.

i also got the lemon pound cake, mostly because it looked so cute sitting on the rack that i couldnt tell it no, and i wanted to have some with tea later. i havent tried it yet but im sure it wont disappoint
author: Amelia R.

description: Wow! The bread, cake and pastries here are so good, I regularly drive in to the city, from Mill Valley (with 3 kids in tow) just to buy their goodies. All their breads are divine, the kids especially like the chocolate bread, the scones and muffins sublime and their gougeres and turnovers make me weep with tears of joy. To cap it all the counter staff are patient and friendly, the bathroom clean and I've never had a problem getting a table. Pure nirvana.
author: Rosanne W.

description:
Best patisserie in the city, including La Boulange and Tartine. 

I find reasons to be in the neighbourhood so I can pop in to pick something up.

The croissants, patisserie, savouries and coffee are all fabulous. Not cheap, but not offensively expensive either. I love this place.
author: Alex W.

description:
I would give this place a 5 star rating but I haven't tried enough product to do so.
Based on the almond croissants, sticky buns, scone, shortbread cookies and a sesame roll this is a solid 4/4.5 stars.
I didn't try the coffee here or any refrigerated pastries but the presentation of all the treats was excellent.
Everything looked well done; staff I'm sure is more than adequately trained in the French baking processes.
Best almond croissants I've had so far! I think I bought 8 of them in 1 1/2 days for me and 2-3 others.
author: George P.

description: Lovely place! "Fantastic" was all I could say about this wonderful affordable delicious bakery! The drip coffee was incredible- the perfect balance of strong aroma and supreme taste. The almond croissant ($2.50) is the best dessert any dollar can buy. The other pastries we had were the apple gallette ($2.15), perfect flavor, very fresh tasting and not dripping with sugar or too sweet (apples are so sweet to begin with!). And the choquettes (4/$1.50) were delicious as well very fresh and sweet. Highly recommend. Only tried a few things this first visit but the pastry presentation definitely makes me yearn for more. Outdoor options as well- in front of cafe and back patio rare to find in the city in this area. Only recommendation is to make the outdoor patio more pleasant, pipe some music in so you can enjoy not hearing the generator- then truly you have the perfect place to enjoy your delicious pastries and cafe!
author: Jennifer P.

description: Love it!  Great breads and pastries.  I get my bread there almost exclusively.
author: Pam D.

description: Finally, truely good artisan bread in San Francisco! Baguettes actually worth buying. Also the best croissants in the city. Simply the best bakery I've found in SF.
author: Allen C.

description: Love this place. Inexpensive home-made soup. Great coffee. Sweet and vinegar-y pulled pork, just the way I like it. Not pork with BBQ sauce poured on it. This southern boy has never tasted better macaroons, perfectly brown and crispy on the outside, creamy on the inside, dipped in chocolate. Yum...and some type of brioche soaked in rum with almonds, not too sweet, perfect with coffee. Good baguette for $1.50. A winner in an expensive neighborhood. Couldn't be better, only missing a sta because I would like more selection.
author: Philip R.

description:
so i was with katie holmes again

and we  were starving 

we had just come back from dolores park

and it was hot out so we decided to 

relax a bit 

so we walked into thorough breads and 

we saw the cutest guy wokring there

didnt know his name but he had plugs

cute hair

and great smile

meanwhile
